We must address the hate that is driving violence in our houses of worship.

My love goes out to those impacted by the shooting at the Chabad of Poway synagogue. On the last day of Passover, and 6 months after the rampage at the Tree of Life synagogue, this is another tragic reason why we need to come together to stand against antisemitism and hate.

April 2 is #EqualPayDay, which is how long into this year it takes women catch up to what men were paid in the previous year. On average, women are paid just 80 cents for every $1 paid to male counterparts.  For women of color, the #wagegap is much larger.

On this Clean Water Action Day, I’m proud to be working with @RepBrianMast to make sure communities have the resources they need to address pollution in their waterways.  Local communities know the most innovative and effective ways to keep water clean and safe.

Whether I’m talking to farmers, families, students, or business owners, I hear the same thing: if healthcare isn’t affordable, it’s not accessible. Proud to be part of such a critical effort in Congress to address healthcare costs now. https://bit.ly/2CHEtq4
